head.title: Minimal installation of the NetBeans platform

description.p: In NetBeans you can choose to install and enable only the modules that contain the functionality that you are looking for. For example in the case where you run NetBeans as an IDE, the number of installed modules are quite large. You may want to just install your module though, and this is also possible. However, there is a minimum of modules that must be present for NetBeans to function. This document describes that minimum installation.

section.title: Set up the minimal NetBeans platform

description.p: We assume that you have the NetBeans Platform installed.

In the NetBeans installation directory, remove
core-ui.jar from the modules subdirectory (contains the menus)
text.jar from the modules subdirectory
core-settings.jar from the modules/autoload subdirectory
core-output.jar from the modules/autoload subdirectory

If you do not want the NetBeans Update Center functionality, remove
updater.jar , from the lib sub-directory
autoupdate.jar, from the modules sub-directory

If you do not want use the JavaHelp, remove
javahelp-api.jar, from the modules/autoload sub-directory
jh-1.1.3.jar, from the modules/autoload/ext sub-directory
